ARABIC: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ لِبَشَرَيْنِ مِثْلِنَا وَقَوْمُهُمَا لَنَا عَٰبِدُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'What! Should we have iman in two human beings like ourselves when their people are our slaves?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And said: "Should we believe in two men like yourselves, whose people are our subjects?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They said: "Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves when their people are slaves to us?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "Should we believe in two mere mortals who are like ourselves and whose people are our slaves?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They therefore said, “Shall we believe in two humans like ourselves, whereas their nation is servile to us?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves, and their people are obedient to us with humility!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they said: What! shall we believe in two mortals like ourselves while their people serve us?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and they said, 'What, shall we believe two mortals like ourselves, whose people are our servants?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves, and whose folk are servile unto us?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Are we to believe in two human beings like ourselves, while their people are subject to us?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So they said: shall we believe In two human beings like unto us, while their nation are to us slaves?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Shall we believe two humans like ourselves, while their people are our slaves?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their people are subject to us!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves, and their people are obedient to us with humility (and we use them to serve us as we like)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What' they said, 'are we to believe in two mortals like us, whose nation are our worshipers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Are we to believe in two mortals like us, and their people are our slaves?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:47] And they said, ‘Shall we believe two humans like ourselves, while their people are servile to us?’, obedient and submissive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And they said: Shall we put faith in two mortals) two human beings, meaning Moses and Aaron (like ourselves, and whose folk are servile unto us) while their people are our obedient servants?
